On DATE the applicant 's claim for payment under the Winter Fuel Payment ( “ ORG ” ) scheme was rejected by ORG , on the ground that as he had left GPE in DATE , before the scheme was introduced , he had “ never acquired entitlement to the benefit . ”
On DATE an appeal against ORG decision was refused on the same grounds as the original decision .

The applicant submitted a further complaint to ORG and was informed by a letter dated DATE that the policy of ORG to restrict the ORG to individuals who had “ acquired entitlement ” by receiving the payment before leaving GPE created a difference in treatment between pensioners , depending on when or how old they were when they moved abroad . However , the policy was not contrary to ORG ( GPE ) PERSON and the matter could not , therefore , be taken further .

In DATE the second applicant applied to be considered for ORG . On DATE his application was turned down on the basis that he had never acquired entitlement to the payment because he had left GPE in DATE . On DATE a final confirmation that he would not be eligible was issued by ORG . The applicant challenged that decision , but never received a reply from ORG .

On DATE , the third applicant applied to be considered for ORG in respect of DATE . On DATE this claim , and her claim for DATE , were turned down on the basis that she had left GPE in DATE , before acquiring entitlement . She claims that she was not resident outside GPE before DATE .

On DATE her appeal was rejected on the same grounds , by ORG . On DATE the ORG Commissioner refused her leave to appeal . This matter was revised because a second pensioner in a similar position had his case considered in the light of GPE law before the Commissioner , in DATE . This latter case was dismissed . Consequently , on CARDINAL DATE the Commissioner refused to set aside his refusal to grant the applicant leave to appeal .
ORG is a non - contributory , non - means tested benefit of MONEY or , for a person aged CARDINAL or over , GBP CARDINAL per annum paid , since DATE , to residents of GPE aged DATE or more .

NORP Regulation CARDINAL/CARDINAL on the co - ordination of social security schemes for people who move within the ORG provides that a person may “ export ” to another Member ORG a social security benefit he or she is entitled to in their home Member ORG . However , the regulation leaves it to the Member GPE to determine the conditions of entitlement to social security benefits , and requires Member GPE only to “ export ” benefits to people who are subject to its legislation .

Following complaints to ORG about the non - availability of ORG to those living outside GPE , in DATE domestic law was amended so that individuals residing in other ORG Member GPE could also receive the DATE fuel payment as long as they had received it before leaving GPE .

According to the DATE legislation , claimants had the choice to leave GPE before reaching DATE with no ORG or remain until reaching DATE , receive CARDINAL payment and thereby export their ORG DATE thereafter .
